articles.headline: Forget ‘Succession.’ You Can Watch ‘90 Day Fiancé’ for 100 Hours Straight.
articles.snippet: Discovery’s new app has taken off largely because viewers love watching people fix houses, tour diners and bicker about their relationships.
articles.abstract: Discovery’s new app has taken off largely because viewers love watching people fix houses, tour diners and bicker about their relationships.
articles.lead_paragraph: “Ninety Day Fiancé” is, on some Sunday nights, the most-watched show on television. And in the latest innovation in streaming, Discovery+ includes a channel that lets you watch it for four days straight without seeing the same episode twice.

articles.headline: How Pro-Trump Forces Pushed a Lie About Antifa at the Capitol Riot
articles.snippet: On social media, on cable networks and even in the halls of Congress, supporters of Donald J. Trump tried to rewrite history in real time, pushing the fiction that left-wing agitators were to blame for the violence on Jan. 6.
articles.abstract: On social media, on cable networks and even in the halls of Congress, supporters of Donald J. Trump tried to rewrite history in real time, pushing the fiction that left-wing agitators were to blame for the violence on Jan. 6.
articles.lead_paragraph: At 1:51 p.m. on Jan. 6, a right-wing radio host named Michael D. Brown wrote on Twitter that rioters had breached the United States Capitol — and immediately speculated about who was really to blame. “Antifa or BLM or other insurgents could be doing it disguised as Trump supporters,” Mr. Brown wrote, using shorthand for Black Lives Matter. “Come on, man, have you never heard of psyops?”
articles.byline: By Michael M. Grynbaum, Davey Alba and Reid J. Epstein

articles.headline: China Charges Ahead With a National Digital Currency
articles.snippet: The electronic Chinese yuan is now being tested in cities such as Shenzhen, Shanghai and Beijing. No other major power is as far along with a homegrown digital currency.
articles.abstract: The electronic Chinese yuan is now being tested in cities such as Shenzhen, Shanghai and Beijing. No other major power is as far along with a homegrown digital currency.
articles.lead_paragraph: Annabelle Huang recently won a government lottery to try China’s latest economics experiment: a national digital currency.
articles.byline: By Nathaniel Popper and Cao Li

articles.headline: How Can Biden Bring Back Manufacturing Jobs? Weaken the Dollar
articles.snippet: Critics of a strong currency say it hurts American factory workers by making imports cheap.
articles.abstract: Critics of a strong currency say it hurts American factory workers by making imports cheap.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Biden has made reviving American manufacturing a top priority. To deliver, he may first have to deal with something even more fundamental to the U.S. economy: the strength of the dollar.
